metadata.title: CVE-2019-19377 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel 5.0.21, mounting a crafted btrfs filesystem image,performing some operations, and unmounting can lead to a use-after-free inbtrfs_queue_work in fs/btrfs/async-thread.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19377` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1091-azure - 4.15.0-1091.101~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1091.101~14.04.1').
